DOC.HEADLINE: ' 93 / ' 94 YEAR-END REVIEW AND OUTLOOK ; INDUSTRY OUTLOOK ; CONTINUING LOW-GRADE GROWTH IN THE NATIONAL ECONOMY , COUPLED WITH HOPES FOR STABILITY -- IF NOT EXPANSION -- IN CALIFORNIA , IS THE BACKDROP FOR THE YEAR IN BUSINESS . HERE IS AN ASSESSMENT OF KEY INDUSTRIES ' PROSPECTS .
DOC.TEXT: AGRICULTURE : Crop production is expected to increase 5 % to 10 % . Farm income will rise ; consumer food price hikes are forecast at 2 % .Export gains and ongoing demand for California produce will increase the state ' s farm income . Federal plans could bedevil California farmers ' water_supplies and , in turn , lead to lower yields . DONALD WOUTAT
